Articles.Content: Hey guys, I've run into a little issue, and I'm wondering if there's a mod that can help me. Right now I'm trying to build a huge mobile kethane tanker/converter, but I'm having a devil of a time with the structural panels as flat mounting points. Right now, I'm running a pod, an adapter, and an I-beam backbone. But the panels are being persnickity. So I'm wondering if there are any mods out there that can provide a stable backbone, AND mounting points for the tanks. I don't want to go with a tanker-truck design, and I don't want to spend hours on end placing panels on the I-beams. So if there are any mounting points that can do both of what I want, my engineers will thank you profusely.
The B9 aerospace pack has some flat panels that you can use.

First off, thanks for making me bite the bullet on the B9 pack. I had DL'd it, and sat on it for awhile. The bad thing is, now my initial loading time is over a minute!

Second, I'm a moron. The Radial Attachment Point is the exact part I needed, and it was right under my nose all along.
